intro: Aegilops comosa f. minor, commonly known as the silky wheatgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. This plant is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in dry, rocky soils. It produces small, pale green spikelets that contain numerous tiny grains. Aegilops comosa f. minor is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance and drought tolerance.
